prompt: Facts: The appellant (Rakesh Kumar K.) was the husband of the deceased, Bindu.; Marriage between the appellant and Bindu took place on 21.08.2003.; Bindu committed suicide by hanging on 21.02.2004, approximately six months after the marriage.; The prosecution alleged that the appellant subjected Bindu to physical and mental cruelty, demanding more dowry (gold ornaments and money), which drove her to commit suicide.; Key prosecution witnesses included PW1 (father of the deceased), PW2 (mother of the deceased), PW3 (brother of the deceased), and neighbours (PW4, PW5).; Allegations included demands for remaining dowry promised at the time of marriage and dissatisfaction with the gold ornaments given.; Specific instances of alleged cruelty mentioned: Appellant allegedly hit the deceased a few days after marriage; complaints made by the deceased to her parents about harassment.; A neighbour (PW4) testified about hearing quarrels.; An inquest report (Ext.P8) and postmortem certificate (Ext.P7) confirmed death by hanging.; No suicide note was found.; The Sessions Court, Kollam found the appellant guilty under Sections 498A and 306 of the IPC.; The appellant was sentenced to Rigorous Imprisonment for two years and a fine for Section 498A, and Rigorous Imprisonment for five years and a fine for Section 306 IPC.; The appellant filed Crl.Appeal No. 237 of 2008 before the High Court of Kerala challenging the conviction and sentence. | IPC: Section 498A, Section 306, Section 34 (Implicit in joint trial considerations, although specific finding might be absent)
